oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Occurrence of two exotic decapods,Macrobrachium nipponense(de Haan, 1849) andProcambarus virginalisLyko, 2017, in Ukrainian waters
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Son, Mikhail
Morhun, Halyna
O. Novitskyi, Roman
Sidorovskyi, Serhii
Kulyk, Maryna
Utevsky, Serge Y.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Macrobrachium nipponense
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>New information on the occurrence of two alien decapod crustaceans,<jats:italic>Macrobrachium nipponense</jats:italic>and<jats:italic>Procambarus virginalis</jats:italic>, was summarized for Ukraine. The invasive potential of both species was estimated in the context of local environmental and socio-economic issues. Their history as non-native species is marked by the early use of alien decapods as a natural resource by local residents. Both intentional and unintentional introductions occurred for<jats:italic>M. nipponense</jats:italic>, while the ornamental trade was an important source of non-native<jats:italic>P. virginalis</jats:italic>. New records of<jats:italic>M. nipponense</jats:italic>and<jats:italic>P. virginalis</jats:italic>from open freshwater habitats in the Odesa and Kharkiv provinces suggest continuing expansion of these decapods. We conducted a molecular phylogenetic analysis of<jats:italic>COI</jats:italic>sequences, which confirmed morphological identifications of invasive<jats:italic>M. nipponense</jats:italic>. This reinforces the presumed pathway of this species, including its pathway from China to south-western Ukraine.<jats:italic>Procambarus fallax</jats:italic>was found to be paraphyletic in relation to<jats:italic>P. virginalis</jats:italic>, which was probably caused by analyzing only one mitochondrial gene, which could be impacted by the recent emergence of the latter species.</jats:p>
